div.p: I like how our school involves parents in the education process. When parents are involved in their own studentsâ€™ lives, the students benefit not only emotionally, but educationally as well.

I appreciate the variety of subjects that are available at BGHS. I think it is good for students to try out many different types of classes while in high school, so they can try and figure out what will interest them.

div.h2: School buildings closed through end of school year
div.p: To help our state and nation slow the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19), Battle Ground Public Schools will educate its 13,000 students remotely. Read about Remote Learning.
Visit the School Closure Information page
Check out our new Home Learning Resources page.
Seniors! We know you have questions, so we created this FAQ just for you.

Meals
Children ages 0â€“18 can pick up a free and nutritious sack lunch and sack breakfast from 11 a.m. to noon weekdays in front of all our primary schools, Amboy Middle, and BGHS and PHS.

Technology Assistance
Battle Ground Public Schools provides technical support for Chromebook and educational software issues and checks out Chromebooks to students. Please visit our Chromebook HelpÂ page for details.

div.div: Out-of-District student transfer process begins May 1 at 7 a.m.

p.span: Application forms for out-of-district student transfers will be accepted electronically starting at 7 a.m. on May 1 for the 2020-21 school year. Transfer requests for next year will NOT be accepted before this date.
While district offices are closed to the public, students who wish to transfer out of the Battle Ground School District need to fill out the
and then return it electronically. Please email your completed and signed forms to
on or after May 1 beginning at 7 a.m., and they will be processed in the order in which they are received. You may request that a transfer form be mailed to you by emailing the boundaries office.
